channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13287] Add logic to estimate stats for IN operator
item.description: Currently, IN operator is considered in the default case: reduces the input rows to the half. This may lead to wrong estimates for the number of rows produced by Filter operators.
item.summary: Add logic to estimate stats for IN operator

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Unnesting IN into ORs for stats estimation may be unnecessary CPU cycles. If possible, we should avoid conversion of IN into OR and try to do stats estimation on IN itself.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12793551/HIVE-13287.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12795069 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

With previous patch of unnesting into AND/OR some of the estimates changed for IN. I dont see any golden file update for stats with new patch, suggesting new logic is not equivalent to old one. Can you comment why its better without unnesting?
I have uploaded a new patch; to keep it short, original patch had the problem that was taking original number of columns as zero for some cases (from evaluatedRowCount). New patch solves that issue.
Some new q files might need to be updated still.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
